templates.name: Celebrity AI anecdote
templates.template: Use a hypothetical encounter or quote involving a famous figure to illustrate a tech/AI point.
templates.example: 'The real danger of AI isn't robots taking jobs... it's how easily fake news will spread'

templates.name: Leverage trending events
templates.template: Tap into a current tech news or event (e.g., ChatGPT outage) and add a creative twist or commentary.
templates.example: 'In a world where AI is the villain... it’s the classic underdog story with a mockery twist'

templates.name: Share personal struggles
templates.template: Begin by describing a genuine challenge or failure (in tech/AI), then explain what you learned or how you overcame it.
templates.example: "Talking about a struggle, a failure, or a critical insight before offering the solution is what truly connects and gets rewarded"

templates.name: Use bullet/numbered lists
templates.template: Present key points or lessons as bullets or a numbered list to make the content easy to scan.
templates.example: "I structure all my posts in a way that is familiar to people, using bullet points, line breaks..."

templates.name: Include concrete examples
templates.template: Illustrate your points with specific, concrete examples or scenarios.
templates.example: "He outlines the strategy—melding significant life events with valuable content—to provide a clear, concise description... he includes three examples to illustrate how to apply this strategy"

templates.name: Highlight industry issues
templates.template: Call out a broader issue or frustration in the tech/AI field and urge a change or solution.
templates.example: "If we want India to lead in AI, this has to change."

templates.name: Subvert common expectations
templates.template: Start with a familiar phrase or assumption, then challenge it with a surprising insight or refutation.
templates.example: "If this is the way you are communicating your job ads on LinkedIn, you are losing candidates."

templates.name: Use vivid analogies or metaphors
templates.template: Use vivid analogies or metaphors to frame your technical content in a relatable way.
templates.example: "In a world where AI is the villain... it’s the classic underdog story with a mockery twist"

templates.name: Authentic, honest tone
templates.template: Write candidly; posts with an authentic (even negative) tone tend to get higher engagement.
templates.example: "Negative and mixed posts are 1.34x more viral... positivity is punished"

templates.name: Storytelling narrative
templates.template: Structure the post as a narrative or story to guide the reader through your content.
templates.example: "Narrative structures that keep people reading"

templates.name: Clear, concise explanation
templates.template: Use clear and concise language to explain your main idea so readers can easily follow.
templates.example: "provide a clear, concise description of his approach"

templates.name: Emotional personal story
templates.template: Share an emotional personal story (e.g., a challenge or success) that resonates with your audience.
templates.example: "A tech lead shared their journey of overcoming imposter syndrome... honesty sparked 300+ comments"

templates.name: Weave narrative with insight
templates.template: Embed your insight within a narrative, as 'stories outperform facts alone'.
templates.example: "Stories outperform facts alone: Viral LinkedIn content often has a story behind data or insights"

templates.name: Relatable experiences
templates.template: Make the content relatable by referencing common experiences or aspirations among your readers.
templates.example: "People share content that reflects their own experiences or aspirations"

templates.name: Actionable takeaways
templates.template: Provide clear actionable takeaways or tips at the end, so readers know what to do next.
templates.example: "Pro tip: Pair your story with actionable advice or a question..."

templates.name: Bold claim then evidence
templates.template: Make a bold, provocative statement and immediately back it up or refute it with evidence.
templates.example: "'Women don't like sales.' 'No. You're wrong.'"

templates.name: Support claims with data
templates.template: Support your statements with data or concrete evidence to increase credibility.
templates.example: "In her viral post, she supports the refutation with compelling statistics about women's success in sales"

templates.name: Provide actionable advice
templates.template: Conclude with specific recommendations or advice that readers can apply.
templates.example: "She concludes with actionable advice for companies on how to attract more women to tech sales positions"

templates.name: Use relevant hashtags
templates.template: Include targeted hashtags to boost visibility among interested audiences.
templates.example: "Incorporating relevant hashtags helps increase the visibility and viral potential of her post"

templates.name: Debunk misconceptions
templates.template: Directly debunk a common myth or misconception in your field to grab attention.
templates.example: "An editorial calendar is NOT a content strategy"

templates.name: Tease information
templates.template: Reveal only part of the information to pique curiosity and encourage readers to click to learn more.
templates.example: "By only revealing part of the information upfront, she leverages the power of curiosity to drive engagement"

templates.name: Deep dive with detail
templates.template: After hooking the reader, dive deep with detailed explanations to thoroughly educate them.
templates.example: "Her post delves into the specifics of what constitutes a content strategy, distinguishing it from an editorial calendar"

templates.name: Share your expertise
templates.template: Share insider tips or exactly how you accomplish something to demonstrate expertise and provide value.
templates.example: "She shares the elements she includes in content strategies for her clients, making the post practical and useful"

templates.name: Personal career narrative
templates.template: Use a personal career anecdote (e.g., first job, salary story) to make your tech insights more engaging.
templates.example: "When I started off in my career as a marketer, I was making under 75k."
